channel.title: WhatsApp HTTP API on WAHA
channel.description: Recent content in WhatsApp HTTP API on WAHA

item.title: 📖 Introduction
item.description: WAHA - WhatsApp HTTP API that you can install on your own server and run in less than 5 minutes!

item.title: ⚡ Quick Start
item.description:
Step-by-Step guide

On this page, you’re going to install and run WAHA, authenticate the client using a QR code, and send your first message to WhatsApp using the API!

item.title: ⚠️ How to Avoid Blocking
item.description:
How to Avoid Blocking in WhatsApp when developing bots.

It’s important to keep in mind that WhatsApp has strict policies in place to prevent spamming and abuse of their platform.

item.title: ❓ FAQ
item.description:
System Requirements

How much CPU and Memory does WAHA need?

WAHA has multiple 🏭 Engines under the hood, and the CPU and Memory requirements change depending on the engine used.

item.title: 🆕 Changelog
item.description:
Get Notified

If you wish to get Monthly Summary about WAHA changes, subscribe to our channels.

You can subscribe on free tier!

item.title: 🔧 Install & Update
item.description: If you wish to follow a Step-By-Step guide which shows you how to send your first message via HTTP API, please go to ⚡ Quick Start.

item.title: 📊 Dashboard
item.description:
Dashboard is a UI to manage your WhatsApp sessions!

You can access Dashboard by running the project and opening http://localhost:3000/dashboard (or similar, but with /dashboard at the end).

item.title: 📚 Swagger (OpenAPI)
item.description:
Overview

The project provides HTTP API (REST), which is documented with OpenAPI specification and Swagger UI.

You can see all available endpoints, request/response examples, and even execute them directly from the Swagger UI.

item.title: 🖥️ Sessions
item.description:
Session represents a WhatsApp Account (Phone Number) connected to WAHA that you can use to send and receive messages.

Features

Here’s the list of features that are available by 🏭 Engines:

item.title: 📤 Send messages
item.description:
We assume that you’ve already run the Docker container and authenticated the session with a QR code.

If you haven’t yet - please follow the steps from ⚡ Quick Start.
